author: Alex Simonides
comment: Now it's alerting me that my phone's disconnected when it isn't, and getting into loops between the two notifications. I'm going to uninstall it for a while.
title: Worked great until last update...

author: Monique Williams
comment: At first it worked fine, but now it will suddenly think it's lost connection when my phone is in my hand and will do that at least 3 times in a row sometimes while I'm just sitting there with the phone or if I've come off of or connected to my WiFi. Uninstalling.
title: Used to work well

author: Robert Fabian
comment: Ten to twelve times a day it decided that it's lost and then regained contact with my phone.  The constant buzzing is annoying.  Uninstalled.
title: Randomly thinks it's lost contact

author: Ken Kern
comment: This used to work really great but now this loses connection all the time.
title: Loses Connection All The time

author: Dennis Bareis
comment: Would be too easy to miss
title: No control over vibration level etc

author: Jill Oldenkamp
comment: I deleted the app after it kept waking me up by disconnecting all night.

author: Manish Manohar
comment: Realises it has lost contact after being away from the phone for a really long time even with the mode set to immediate alert..not at all useful in case you are counting on it to alert you if you left your phone behind. Even if you lost your phone and your memory, you will probably remember that you are missing your phone way before this app realizes it.  And switching to display the alert on the phone is a different lvl of headache all together. If your watch runs out of charge or if you manually disconnect it this keeps showing notifications every 30seconds which is really irritating.

author: Brandon Bryant
comment: I walk a loonnngggg way to class everyday and this thing decided to tap me on the wrist a 1/2 a mile away. It does it on a regular basis to. It just doesn't work well enough in its current state to be usable.
title: Needs work.

author: Kristofor Sherdley
comment: I left my phone sitting on a table and went into another room to lie down. Half an hour later my watch vibrates to say it had lost contact. Good job I wasn't driving anywhere. Then a minute later it vibrates again saying I'm getting closer but I'm still lying down and not moving, so my watch is moving? Nope, its still on the table where I left it.
title: Doesn't work properly

author: Marienne Figueroa
comment: I have the Zenwatch 2 and I just got contact notifications it loses connection from my pocket! The watch battery would be eight hours with the app giving false notifications. I uninstalled it and it's back to its regular battery life. Would love to use it once it's fixed!
title: Loses Connection, Battery Drainer

author: Paul Bramstedt
comment: This was wonderful before the last few updates. It began to lock up my watch and so I went to uninstall it. Pear will would not uninstall from my Asus Zen watch. I ended up having to factory reset to get rid of it, ugh.   I did try removing other applications to see if it was Pear, or the device. It was Pear.

author: Colly Fitz
comment: I love it but I dont want the "Need help finding your phone" reminder when it comes back into range. Can you add an option to turn this off? I just want it to buzz when going out of range.
title: Really good but needs more options

author: Al M
comment: Frequently reporting that the phone is out of range.  Thought it might be a problem with my watch until I looked at these other reviews.  Hope this essential app is soon restored to its former glory.
title: Yup.  Finicky.

author: Redwan Huq
comment: The only issue is that when a phone returns into the proximity of the watch, the app isn't smart enough to discard the notification alert. Very annoying.
title: Needs fine tuning

author: Android300ZXNA
comment: It only vibrates twice so if you don't feel it vibrate (running around, carrying stuff) you may lose your phone forever. Make it consistently vibrate until you dismiss on watch. Thanks.
title: Make it consistently vibrate.

author: Carlos Guedes Valente
comment: Mainly for being the first application among thousands of trash that really does what all wear androids needs. Congratulations and Many thanks!

author: Arien Crossby
comment: Good in theory, and I like the design, but often when alerting me to the phone being out of range it crashes the Android Wear UI on my Moto 360 2nd gen. Also it occasionally claims the phone is out of range when it's sitting a foot away and still visibly connected.

author: Beau Williams
comment: I just want a buzz when I leave my phone behind. Seeing as it buzzes soon after disconnect I wouldn't have forgotten where I last put my phone yet
title: Any way to disable getting close card?

comment: Shortly after I downloaded/installed this, Android Wear was updated to include "find my nearby phone" functionality... But I kept 🍐 around because it works just as well, and looks much nicer; in other words, with an up-to-date Android Wear device, you don't need 🍐, but it is certainly far more appealing than Android Wear's (now) built-in functionality.
title: A cute application that works well.

author: Gregorio Saucedo
comment: Handy app lets you know if you for got you phone and if you for got it you can make it ring ...... The only problem is that ever since the updates i haven't been able to make my phone ring it just shows the you found me screen. If the ring my phone feature was working properly i would of given it a 5 stars.

reply.author: dConstructing
reply.content: The "found me" screen comes up, but the alarm doesn't sound? I'll have to look into this.

author: Vittorio Fabregas
comment: Would love it if there was an option to  be notified only by vibration and not an entire card when it reconnects. I feel the card is only important when it disconnects.
title: Great app, saved me alot of time

author: Ryan Cam
comment: Would be 5 stars but I can't stop the alarm from my LG G Watch. Other than that, great app.
title: Can't stop alarm from G Watch

author: Jeroen Debois
comment: It does its job (reminding when your phone is no longer connected or vice versa), but I'd love to see some more options. For example an option to disable/enable the "getting close - want help finding your phone" notification, because I personally would only like to be notified about forgetting my phone/watch ☺
title: Could use more options

author: Petr Svirák
comment: It works quite nicely, however, bluetooth (not app's problem) is simply not precise enough for me  and the  app then  drains watch's battery for nothing...

author: melly j
comment: Keeps saying phone is out of range when both phone and watch are next to each other.  Uninstalling.
title: Too sensitive.

author: David Sauder
comment: Using w Moto 360 and Galaxy S4 - repeated disconnects from phone even though they are inches from each other.  The warn tone is really annoying...in the middle of the night!!  I'm switching back to Wear Buddy.

author: collin cherry
comment: It doesn't ring my phone anymore. the found me screen pops up but no sound.
title: Galaxy s5 moto 360

author: Ethan Burnham
comment: Constantly goes off even when the phone is 2 inches from it.
title: Just about worthless

author: James Miller
comment: It worked great on all my phones but I just got a new one with android N and I get no sound when I ring my phone please help

author: James Baron
comment: It have some good ideas but be good if the vibration level could be adjusted and if the icon could change to something a bit better.
title: It's an alright app

author: jimmy williams
comment: Keeps going off although phone is nearby.
title: Nope

author: Jonathan Simon
comment: Handy app. Some other apps serve a similar purpose but Pear does its job without fail.
title: Sony smartwatch 3

author: Hunter Dinh
comment: After updating to 5.1.1 on my Moto 360. I have not recieve alert notification..
title: No notification?

author: Alex Welch
comment: Can't get the app to stop silencing my alarms. Lol please help not sure what's happening
title: Help

comment: Works fine to me, the option to vibrate the phone too it's very useful.
title: Pretty good

author: pseudosoul.
comment: It's an interesting idea. Plus it works. It's just not for me. I still recommend it though!
title: Cute.

author: Juan José Medina
comment: It would be a perfect app if it lets select a specific ringtone
title: Needs Ringtone selection

author: Dalia Armada
comment: Cannot customize the ringtone. Uninstalling :(

author: Michael Rupchock
comment: Leather band
title: Moto 360

author: Ninad Kanetkar
comment: Not very good
